00596 #define EXP_OP_STATIC     0x00  
00597 #define EXP_OP_SIG        0x01  
00598 #define EXP_OP_XOR        0x02  
00599 #define EXP_OP_MULTIPLY   0x03

00640 #define EXP_OP_DELAY      0x2c  
00641 #define EXP_OP_CASE       0x2d

00643 #define EXP_OP_CASEZ      0x2f  
00644 #define EXP_OP_DEFAULT    0x30  
00645 #define EXP_OP_LIST       0x31  
00646 #define EXP_OP_PARAM      0x32  
00647 #define EXP_OP_PARAM_SBIT 0x33  
00648 #define EXP_OP_PARAM_MBIT 0x34  
00655 #define EXPR_IS_MEASURABLE(x)      (((SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_STATIC) && \
00656                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_LAST) && \
00657                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_LIST) && \
00658                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_COND_SEL) && \
00659                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_CASE) && \
00660                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_CASEX) && \
00661                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_CASEZ) && \
00662                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_DEFAULT) && \
00663                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_PARAM) && \
00664                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_PARAM_SBIT) && \
00665                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_PARAM_MBIT) && \
00666                                      (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) != EXP_OP_DELAY) && \
00667                                      !((SUPPL_IS_ROOT( x->suppl ) == 0) && \
00668                                        ((SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_SIG) || \
00669                                         (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_SBIT_SEL) || \
00670                                         (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_MBIT_SEL)) && \
00671                                        (SUPPL_OP( x->parent->expr->suppl ) != EXP_OP_COND))) ? 1 : 0)
00672 
00677 #define EXPR_IS_STATIC(x)        ((SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_STATIC)     || \
00678                                   (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_PARAM)      || \
00679                                   (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_PARAM_SBIT) || \
00680                                   (SUPPL_OP( x->suppl ) == EXP_OP_PARAM_MBIT))
00681 
00686 #define EXPR_COMB_MISSED(x)        (EXPR_IS_MEASURABLE( x ) & \
00687                                     ~expression_is_static_only( x ) & \
00688                                     (~SUPPL_WAS_TRUE( x->suppl ) | ~SUPPL_WAS_FALSE( x->suppl )))

01150  $Log$
01151  Revision 1.64  2003/01/04 09:25:15  phase1geo
01152  Fixing file search algorithm to fix bug where unexpected module that was
01153  ignored cannot be found.  Added instance7.v diagnostic to verify appropriate
01154  handling of this problem.  Added tree.c and tree.h and removed define_t
01155  structure in lexer.
01156 
01157  Revision 1.63  2003/01/03 05:52:01  phase1geo
01158  Adding code to help safeguard from segmentation faults due to array overflow
01159  in VCD parser and symtable.  Reorganized code for symtable symbol lookup and
01160  value assignment.
01161 
01162  Revision 1.62  2002/12/07 17:46:52  phase1geo
01163  Fixing bug with handling memory declarations.  Added diagnostic to verify
01164  that memory declarations are handled properly.  Fixed bug with infinite
01165  looping in statement_connect function and optimized this part of the score
01166  command.  Added diagnostic to verify this fix (always9.v).  Fixed bug in
01167  report command with ordering of lines and combinational logic verbose output.
01168  This is now fixed correctly.
01169 
01170  Revision 1.61  2002/12/06 02:18:59  phase1geo
01171  Fixing bug with calculating list and concatenation lengths when MBIT_SEL
01172  expressions were included.  Also modified file parsing algorithm to be
01173  smarter when searching files for modules.  This change makes the parsing
01174  algorithm much more optimized and fixes the bug specified in our bug list.
01175  Added diagnostic to verify fix for first bug.
01176 
01177  Revision 1.60  2002/11/27 03:49:20  phase1geo
01178  Fixing bugs in score and report commands for regression.  Finally fixed
01179  static expression calculation to yield proper coverage results for constant
01180  expressions.  Updated regression suite and development documentation for
01181  changes.
01182 
01183  Revision 1.59  2002/11/24 14:38:12  phase1geo
01184  Updating more regression CDD files for bug fixes.  Fixing bugs where combinational
01185  expressions were counted more than once.  Adding new diagnostics to regression
01186  suite.
01187 
01188  Revision 1.58  2002/11/23 21:27:25  phase1geo
01189  Fixing bug with combinational logic being output when unmeasurable.
01190 
01191  Revision 1.57  2002/11/23 16:10:46  phase1geo
01192  Updating changelog and development documentation to include FSM description
01193  (this is a brainstorm on how to handle FSMs when we get to this point).  Fixed
01194  bug with code underlining function in handling parameter in reports.  Fixing bugs
01195  with MBIT/SBIT handling (this is not verified to be completely correct yet).
01196 
01197  Revision 1.56  2002/11/05 00:20:06  phase1geo
01198  Adding development documentation.  Fixing problem with combinational logic
01199  output in report command and updating full regression.
01200 
01201  Revision 1.55  2002/10/31 23:13:36  phase1geo
01202  Fixing C compatibility problems with cc and gcc.  Found a few possible problems
01203  with 64-bit vs. 32-bit compilation of the tool.  Fixed bug in parser that
01204  lead to bus errors.  Ran full regression in 64-bit mode without error.
01205 
01206  Revision 1.54  2002/10/29 19:57:50  phase1geo
01207  Fixing problems with beginning block comments within comments which are
01208  produced automatically by CVS.  Should fix warning messages from compiler.
01209 
01210  Revision 1.53  2002/10/25 13:43:49  phase1geo
01211  Adding statement iterators for moving in both directions in a list with a single
01212  pointer (two-way).  This allows us to reverse statement lists without additional
01213  memory and time (very efficient).  Full regression passes and TODO list items
01214  2 and 3 are completed.
01215
